message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about heat and insulation. Wearing fluffy socks helps to retain your own thermal energy because they provide insulation. The fluffy material traps heat close to your body, preventing it from escaping. Option (A) sitting in snow would actually make you lose thermal energy because snow is a good conductor of heat. Option (C) sleeping in freezers and (D) bathing in ice would also cause you to lose thermal energy because these actions involve direct contact with a cold substance.

This question requires knowledge about heat transfer and ways to retain thermal energy. Option (B) is the correct answer because wearing fluffy socks helps to insulate your feet, reducing heat loss. Snow (option A) can actually cause heat loss through conduction, so sitting in it would not help retain thermal energy. Sleeping in freezers (option C) and bathing in ice (option D) would actually lead to a significant loss of thermal energy.

This question requires basic knowledge about how heat is retained in the body. Option (B) is correct because wearing fluffy socks or warm clothing helps to insulate the body and retain its own thermal energy. Option (A) is incorrect because sitting in snow would actually cause body heat to be lost. Option (C) is incorrect because sleeping in freezers would also cause body heat to be lost. Option (D) is incorrect because bathing in ice would also cause body heat to be lost.
